intro: Manettia poliodes, commonly known as the waxy leaf manettia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for collectors and gardeners.
